pullrequest.title: Port obj invalid mtl fix from gazebo

content.raw:
Done! \(Also fixed a few other small things\). Note that if an object doesn’t have an mtl file the tinyobj::LoadObj function will also return some warnings so the total output for a typical obj asset without an associated mtl will now be:

```
[ign-11] [Wrn] [OBJLoader.cc:79] Material file [ [asset_path]/meshes/PotatoChipChair_Col.mtl ] not found.
[ign-11] Failed to load material file(s). Use default material.
[ign-11] [Wrn] [OBJLoader.cc:146] Missing material for shape[PotatoChipsChair_Col] in OBJ file[[asset_path]/meshes/PotatoChipChair_Col.obj]
```

But I guess the two warnings are slightly different and there would be cases in which only the second will be printed \(i.e. a valid mtl file exists but _some_ of the shapes have no valid material\) so it should be alright.
content.html:
Done! (Also fixed a few other small things). Note that if an object doesn’t have an mtl file the tinyobj::LoadObj function will also return some warnings so the total output for a typical obj asset without an associated mtl will now be:

[ign-11] [Wrn] [OBJLoader.cc:79] Material file [ [asset_path]/meshes/PotatoChipChair_Col.mtl ] not found.
[ign-11] Failed to load material file(s). Use default material.
[ign-11] [Wrn] [OBJLoader.cc:146] Missing material for shape[PotatoChipsChair_Col] in OBJ file[[asset_path]/meshes/PotatoChipChair_Col.obj]

But I guess the two warnings are slightly different and there would be cases in which only the second will be printed (i.e. a valid mtl file exists but some of the shapes have no valid material) so it should be alright.
